title.value: Scalar Invariant Networks with Zero Bias
title.justification: It is the exact title listed at the beginning of the provided research paper.

extractions.description: This paper argues that bias terms, which are typically included in many popular machine learning models including neural networks, can be disregarded for some image-related tasks such as image classification. The focus is on zero-bias neural networks, which are shown to possess an important property called scalar (multiplication) invariance. This invariance ensures that a network's prediction remains unchanged when the contrast of the input image is altered. The paper extends scalar invariance to more general cases and discusses its implications for robustness and fairness in neural network predictions.

type.justification: The paper provides experimental results on popular image classification benchmarks as well as theoretical proofs to validate the scalar invariant property of zero-bias neural networks.
type.quote: We also conduct experiments on a few popular image classification benchmarks to validate the scalar invariant property.

name.justification: The research focus is on image classification tasks and exploring intrinsic properties of images.
name.quote: We argue that biases can be disregarded for some image-related tasks such as image classification.

name.justification: The paper specifically evaluates zero-bias neural networks in the context of image classification benchmarks.
name.quote: Our findings suggest that zero-bias neural networks can perform comparably to biased networks for practical image classification tasks.

name.justification: The paper discusses the robustness of zero-bias neural networks under a varying contrast of the input image and provides robustness guarantees for certain regions of the input space.
name.quote: Based on the scalar invariant property, we propose two additional robustness properties that verify inputs along certain lines (interpolations) and convex regions of the input space.

name.justification: The paper explores how zero-bias neural networks offer fairness in predicting the zero image and the potential to eliminate biases in AI systems.
name.quote: We also discover that scalar invariant neural networks exhibit complete fairness when predicting zero images.

name.justification: The paper introduces and validates the concept of zero-bias neural networks for image classification tasks.
name.quote: Our findings suggest that zero-bias neural networks can perform comparably to biased networks for practical image classification tasks.

is_compared.justification: Zero-bias neural networks are compared with normal neural networks in terms of performance and robustness.
is_compared.quote: We further demonstrate the effect of scalar invariance by evaluating their accuracy on test sets multiplied by different scalars.
